result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Moses Lee Sheffel

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot,ADA:   Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Alex Stormont   DF:  Moses Lee Sheffel appeared from jail. Includes 16CM62, 16CM72, 16CM119 and 16TR101. Case called at 9:52 am. There is an agreement. ADA Correll recites. No objection from Atty Stormont.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count #2 in 16CM119.     Court questions Defendant.  Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights.  Attorneys stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts.  Court finds Defendant Guilty of Count #2 in 16CM119. 16CM62, 16CM72, Count #1 in 16CM119 and 16TR101 read in and dismissed read in for purposes of sentencing. Parties make sentencing arguments. Court questions Def. Court orders: 1 yr probation w/h with conditions - 
- 25 Days Jail STAYED. Credit does not go towards stayed jail time
- Court Costs - $243.00
- DNA Surcharge - $200.00. Apply Bond
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to operate motor vehicle without a valid license
- Not to possess a firearm
- No contact with Walmart in New Richmond, Gregory Bowman and Peter Lacanter
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Sign up for probation bt 9:30 am on 4/25/2016
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
Eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation
Attorney's to determine jail credit
Pre-trial conference on April 13, 2016 at 09:45 am.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Gross, Clerk: Minot, ADA:   Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Alex Stormont   DF:  Moses Lee Sheffel appeared from jail. Includes: 16TR101, 16CM119, 16CM72, 16CM62. Cases called at 10:57 am. ADA Correll updates Court, a resolution may be reached. Bond continues. Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 13, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Status conference on March 28, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Per RMW 3/14/16 - Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif
Status conference on March 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.

INCLUDES 16CM62, 16CM72 & 16CM119

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Sara W., Peter L., or Wal-Mart in New Richmond WI.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.

ADA Nieskes is requesting $1000.00 CB, Atty Caton argues.  Status conference scheduled for March 23, 2016 at 10:30 am.
